ai-ud5.5:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, in the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother.
ai-ud5.5:1.3_0: On one occasion on the observance day, he was seated surrounded by the Sangha of monks.
ai-ud5.5:2.1_0: Then, when the night was well advanced and the first part of the night was over, Venerable Ānanda got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and said to him:
ai-ud5.5:2.2_0: “Sir, the night is getting late. It is the second watch of the night, and the visiting mendicants have been sitting long.
ai-ud5.5:2.3_0: the first part of the night,
ai-ud5.5:2.4_0: The Saṅgha has been sitting long.
ai-ud5.5:3.1_0: At the end of the middle part of the night, Venerable Ānanda asked a second time,
ai-ud5.5:3.2_0: “Sir, the night is getting late. It is the second watch of the night, and the visiting mendicants have been sitting long.
ai-ud5.5:3.3_0: the middle part of the night,
ai-ud5.5:3.4_0: The Saṅgha has been sitting long.
ai-ud5.5:4.1_0: And for a third time, Venerable Ānanda told the Buddha all that had happened, put his upper robe over one shoulder, raise his joined palms, and said to the Buddha,
ai-ud5.5:4.2_0: “Sir, the night is getting late. It is the second watch of the night, and the visiting mendicants have been sitting long.
ai-ud5.5:4.3_0: the last one of the night,
ai-ud5.5:4.6_0: The Saṅgha has been sitting long.
ai-ud5.5:4.8_0: And the Buddha replied, “Ānanda, the gathering is impure.”
ai-ud5.5:5.4_0: He then read the minds of the the the entire Sangha of monks.
ai-ud5.5:5.5_0: He saw that unethical person, of bad qualities, filthy, with suspicious behavior, underhand, no true ascetic or spiritual practitioner—though claiming to be one—rotten inside, corrupt, and depraved, sitting in the middle of the Saṅgha.
ai-ud5.5:5.6_0: He went up to him and said,
ai-ud5.5:5.7_0: he asked that monk to leave.
ai-ud5.5:5.8_0: You don’t belong to the community of monks.”
ai-ud5.5:6.2_0: he asked that monk to leave.
ai-ud5.5:6.3_0: You don’t belong to the community of monks.”
ai-ud5.5:7.1_0: Mahāmoggallāna then grabbed him by the arms, took him outside the gateway, and fastened the bolts.
ai-ud5.5:7.5_0: He said, “It’s incredible, Moggallāna, it’s amazing.
ai-ud5.5:7.6_0: how that silly man waited to be taken by the arm!”
ai-ud5.5:8.1_0: The Buddha said to the mendicants,
ai-ud5.5:8.2_0: “From this day forth, mendicants, I will not perform the sabbath or recite the monastic code.
ai-ud5.5:8.3_0: Now you should perform the sabbath and recite the monastic code.
ai-ud5.5:8.4_0: It’s impossible for the Buddha to do the observance-day procedure and recite the Monastic Code in an impure gathering.
ai-ud5.5:9.1_0: Seeing these eight incredible and amazing things the demons love the ocean.
ai-ud5.5:9.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by eight?
ai-ud5.5:10.1_0: The ocean slopes and inclines gradually. It does not drop off all at once.
ai-ud5.5:10.2_0: The ocean gradually slants, slopes, and inclines, with no abrupt precipice.
ai-ud5.5:10.3_0: This is the first thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-ud5.5:11.1_0: The ocean is steady. It does not go beyond the shoreline.
ai-ud5.5:11.3_0: This is the second thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-ud5.5:12.1_0: Furthermore, the ocean does not have a corpse.
ai-ud5.5:12.1_1: but quickly carries it to the shore and strands it on the beach.
ai-ud5.5:12.2_0: The ocean doesn’t accommodate a corpse, but quickly carries it to the shore and strands it on the beach.
ai-ud5.5:12.3_0: This is the third thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-ud5.5:13.1_0: When the great rivers—the Ganges, the Yamunā, the Aciravatī, the Sarabhū, or the Mahī—reach the ocean, they lose their former names and become known simply as the ocean.
ai-ud5.5:13.1_1: they are reckoned as a ocean.
ai-ud5.5:13.2_0: When they reach the ocean, all the great rivers—that is, the Ganges, Yamunā, Aciravatī, Sarabhū, and Mahī—lose their names and clans and are simply considered ‘the ocean’.
ai-ud5.5:13.3_0: This is the fourth thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-ud5.5:14.1_0: Whatever rivers in the world flow into the ocean and whatever rain falls into it, the ocean is not diminished or filled up because of that.
ai-ud5.5:14.2_0: For all the world’s streams that reach it, and the rain that falls from the sky, the ocean never empties or fills up.
ai-ud5.5:14.3_0: This is the fifth thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-ud5.5:15.1_0: Furthermore, the ocean has just one taste, the taste of salt.
ai-ud5.5:15.2_0: The ocean has only one taste,
ai-ud5.5:15.3_0: This is the sixth thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-ud5.5:16.1_0: Furthermore, the ocean is full of many kinds of treasures, such as the ocean.
ai-ud5.5:16.1_1: And there are precious things—pearls, gems, beryl, conch, quartz, coral, silver, gold, rubies, and emeralds.
ai-ud5.5:16.2_0: When the ocean is full of many kinds of treasures, such as pearls, gems, beryl, conch, quartz, coral, silver, gold, rubies, and emeralds.
ai-ud5.5:16.3_0: This is the seventh thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-ud5.5:17.1_0: Furthermore, many great beings live in the ocean, such as leviathans, leviathan-gulpers, leviathan-gulper-gulpers, demons, dragons, and fairies.
ai-ud5.5:17.1_1: In the world, the demons, dragons, and fairies.
ai-ud5.5:17.1_2: In the ocean there are life-forms a hundred leagues long, or even two hundred, three hundred, four hundred, or five hundred leagues long.
ai-ud5.5:17.2_0: In the ocean there are great beings in the ocean—sea-monsters, antigods, dragons, and divinities; creatures with bodies one thousand kilometers long, two thousand, three thousand, four thousand, and five thousand kilometers long—
ai-ud5.5:17.3_0: This is the eighth thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-ud5.5:17.4_0: Seeing these eight incredible and amazing things the demons love the ocean.
ai-ud5.5:18.1_0: In the same way, seeing eight incredible and amazing things, mendicants, the mendicants love this teaching and training.
ai-ud5.5:18.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by eight?
ai-ud5.5:19.1_0: Just as the ocean slopes and inclines gradually, and does not drop off all at once,
ai-ud5.5:19.2_0: In the same way in this teaching and training the penetration to enlightenment comes from gradual training, progress, and practice, not abruptly.
ai-ud5.5:19.3_0: In this teaching and training, there are gradual progress, and practice, not abruptly.
ai-ud5.5:19.4_0: This is the first thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-ud5.5:20.1_0: The ocean is consistent and doesn’t overflow its boundaries.
ai-ud5.5:20.2_0: In the same way, when a training rule is laid down for my disciples they wouldn’t break it even for the sake of their own life.
ai-ud5.5:20.4_0: This is the second thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-ud5.5:21.1_0: The ocean does not tolerate dead bodies,
ai-ud5.5:21.1_1: but quickly carries it to the shore and strands it on the beach.
ai-ud5.5:21.2_0: In the same way, the Saṅgha doesn’t accommodate a person who is unethical, of bad qualities, filthy, with suspicious behavior, underhand, no true ascetic or spiritual practitioner—though claiming to be one—rotten inside, corrupt, and depraved.
ai-ud5.5:21.2_2: But they quickly gather and expel them. Even if such a person is sitting in the middle of the Saṅgha, they’re far from the Saṅgha, and the Saṅgha is far from them.
ai-ud5.5:21.3_0: When the Saṅgha is unethical, of bad qualities, filthy, with suspicious behavior, underhand, no true ascetic or spiritual practitioner—though claiming to be one—rotten inside, corrupt, and depraved.
ai-ud5.5:21.3_2: But they quickly gather and expel them. Even if such a person is sitting in the middle of the Saṅgha, they’re far from the Saṅgha, and the Saṅgha is far from them.
ai-ud5.5:21.4_0: This is the third thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-ud5.5:22.1_0: Furthermore, when they reach the ocean, all the great rivers—that is, the Ganges, Yamunā, Aciravatī, Sarabhū, and Mahī—lose their names and clans and are simply considered ‘the ocean’.
ai-ud5.5:22.2_0: In the same way, when they go forth from the lay life to homelessness, all four castes—aristocrats, brahmins, merchants, and workers—lose their former names and clans and are simply considered ‘Sakyan ascetics’.
ai-ud5.5:22.3_0: This is another reason why they lose their former name and class and become known simply as Sakyans
ai-ud5.5:22.4_0: This is the fourth thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-ud5.5:23.1_0: For all the world’s streams that reach it, and the rain that falls from the sky, the ocean never empties or fills up.
ai-ud5.5:23.2_0: In the same way, though several mendicants become fully extinguished through the natural principle of extinguishment, without anything left over, the natural principle of extinguishment never empties or fills up.
ai-ud5.5:23.3_0: While many monks are extinguished without remainder, there is no decrease or filling up of the element of extinguishment.
ai-ud5.5:23.4_0: This is the fifth thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-ud5.5:24.1_0: Just as the ocean has only one taste, the taste of salt,
ai-ud5.5:24.2_0: In the same way, this teaching and training has one taste, the taste of freedom.
ai-ud5.5:24.3_0: This is the one taste of freedom.
ai-ud5.5:24.4_0: This is the sixth thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-ud5.5:25.1_0: The ocean is full of many kinds of treasures, such as pearls, gems, beryl, conch, quartz, coral, silver, gold, rubies, and emeralds.
ai-ud5.5:25.2_0: In the same way, this teaching and training is full of many kinds of treasures, such as the following.
ai-ud5.5:25.2_1: There are these four kinds of mindfulness meditation: the four right efforts, the four bases of psychic power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven awakening factors, and the noble eightfold path.
ai-ud5.5:25.3_0: This is the four kinds of mindfulness meditation ...
ai-ud5.5:25.4_0: This is the seventh thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-ud5.5:26.1_0: Many great beings live in the ocean, such as leviathans, leviathan-gulpers, leviathan-gulper-gulpers, demons, dragons, and fairies. In the ocean there are life-forms a hundred leagues long, or even two hundred, three hundred, four hundred, or five hundred leagues long.
ai-ud5.5:26.2_0: In the same way, great beings live in this teaching and training, and these are those beings. The stream-enterer and the one practicing to realize the fruit of stream-entry. The once-returner and the one practicing to realize the fruit of once-return. The non-returner and the one practicing to realize the fruit of non-return. The perfected one, and the one practicing for perfection.
ai-ud5.5:26.4_0: This is the eighth thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-ud5.5:26.5_0: Seeing these eight incredible and amazing things, the mendicants love this teaching and training.”
ai-ud5.5:27.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud5.5:28.1_0: The rain saturates things that are covered up;
ai-ud5.5:28.4_0: so the rain will not saturate it.”
